summary: This code reads a file named "makeDatabase.py" and uses regular expressions to extract strings enclosed in triple quotes (""""). It then prints the extracted strings, but mentions needing transformation next.

details.comment: This code reads a file named "makeDatabase.py" and uses regular expressions to extract strings enclosed in triple quotes (""""). It then prints the extracted strings, but mentions needing transformation next.
details.content:
# This is called the metaProgramming and basically any fucking prog lang can do this fuck!
import re
with open("makeDatabase.py","r") as s:
    so=re.findall(r'(""").+(""")',s.read())
    print(so)
    # I need transformation now!
